reviews.review_msg: Past reviews have noted that Jenn doesn't have structured lectures, but that's not true now. She actually has handouts which is something phil profs rarely do. I actually feel like I learn things in her class and she definitely is very knowledgeable about metaphysics. Definitely would take again!
avoid if possible
Very subjective grading. The feedback on my essay made zero sense
Pretty average class. Material was not difficult but the classes are boring
Expect zero support. Its like trying to understand a different language. Makes the class unnecessarily difficult to understand to boost her own ego
Kino is a great professor. Do the readings guys. This is a 300-level class
Very difficult to understand what she's trying to say. Tends to ramble on and on

The lectures are a mess, grading feels unfair, and you'll spend more time stressing than actually learning. Honestly, you'll end up wondering why you put yourself through it. Save yourself the headache and avoid this one.

Kino was the worst professor I've had at SFU. She's impossible to approach and often passive-aggressive, making the classroom feel hostile. She treats students like they're beneath her and grades way too harshly. Feedback is minimal and unhelpful. Her attitude is downright mean, and it's hard to learn in that environment. Avoid her if you can.

This class was such a letdown. The readings were dull and felt pointless, and Kino's explanations didn't make things any clearer. The whole course felt random, like assignments and grades were made up as we went. There was no real feedback or guidance.
Alright professor, but does not make an effort to engage students
The expectations for this course are very unclear. Kino does not understand how to communicate well to students. I felt that she was talking to herself, rather than addressing students
Most useless course I've taken at SFU. Didn't learn anything useful from the lectures
Very disappointing by the quality of this class. The readings are uninspiring and Kino does not explain the material well. The course and grading felt very arbitrary
Grading felt pretty subjective
Kino just reads off the slides. Doesn't know how to explain stuff

Not sure why her ratings are so bad, assuming it has something to do with the subject matter she teaches (ngl, it's challenging). 
I would say she is pretty good at expanding on the points she makes in slides and she is open to questions and ideas in class. She is blunt but her feedback is genuinely good, and her office hours help a ton.
reads directly off the slides, shuts your ideas down, lectures were not engaging AT ALL.

It may not be a very interesting class, but Kino takes care of the students and offers great tips on writing at her best. If you want to learn new things and have an interest in the philosophy of Science, I recommend this course. If not, this course can be hard for you.
Constantly forgets things. Grades are arbitrary. Regret taking this course

Kino is the least approachable professor I've had as a phil student at sfu. She is passive aggressive at best and belittling at worst. She legitimately conducts her classroom environment like she is a dictator. Do not take her if you can help it. Also grades very harshly. Unhelpful feedback. She is really mean spirited and it's palpable.
Kino doesn't understand how to respect students. DO NOT TAKE HER CLASSES

Good prof overall. Great choice of readings, clear grading & gives constructive feedback. Friendly but sometimes too accommodating and entertains all ideas equally, leading to quantity over quality class discussions. Has a lot of insight into her domain that makes for a pleasant educational experience
Grading is very arbitrary, based on subjective opinion. Holly's justification for the grades she hands out does not make much sense

To me, this course was really interesting towards the beginning but the later reading were either to dense or boring. The papers were a great exercise for concise writing but she is the only prof i have ever had that scales down! If you want a course that will both challenge and captivate you, I recommend this course.

Dry and scattered reading material: is this a philosophy class- or is this quantum physics/neuroscience 101?  Topics were pretentious and hard to read through. Lectures were mostly discussion based, but her explanations were clear and concise. More structure would have been nice, as opposed to 2hrs of keeners quoting wikipedia. Fair grading.

Amazing professor. Wonderful person, very very helpful. Will take her time to make sure everyone understands. Patient with students and gives helpful feedback. There is not a single thing I can find that is wrong with her. Only thing is, she distracts you sometimes in lecture because she's so good looking.

Definitely the best philosophy prof ever. She's crystal clear, and easy to understand - able to whip up helpful diagrams and analogies seemingly at whim. She facilitates engaging class discussions. Her lectures are never boring.
Awesome professor!! Very good at explaining, very very very nice person. Try to take as many courses with her as you can!

Dr. Hanson is one of the best philosophy professor at SFU! I wasn't really interested in Metaphysics and Epistemology but he has made it very fun and enlightening. Too bad it is his last semester. He's very caring and helpful. Always crack jokes to lighten up the lecture. He grades very leniently.

Phil covers everything in class. But your dealing with theorems and different philosophers methods and whether they tell you the truth!! It is an intellectual mèlé !! That said, he is very funny and approachable and you can ask him any question, he will never make you feel like it was ridiculous. If math isn't your thing, it will still be okay.

Loved this course.  I already love epistemology, but this course what like an epistemology-geek's heaven.  Course was intense in that it juggled a lot of material and a wide range of approaches to the topic, but it was so well handled.  Hanson is really the prof you want to go to if you want to learn (a lot)! :)
One of the best philosophy professors i have ever met. Well-prepared for almost every single lecture.

Her lectures can be a bit monotone, but she is a decent prof overall who's unfairly given a bad rep. Interesting readings, consistent workload throughout the semester, clear instructions. Records all lecs and she also records content when she cannot make a lecture for fam reasons (not like we are losing out on material). Overall would take again!
